subdivision_of_building: the original land was open waste storage.

open_spaces_details.description: covered area for waste recycling as required by the environmental agency

decision_conditions: The building, due to its design, inconsistent materiality and colour, its height and proximity to the Grand Union Canal, results in a development that is poor quality and discordant in appearance. The development fails to respond positively into the existing industrial and canalside environment harmoniously. The building is out of character when viewed from the Canal's towpath and surrounding streets, to the detriment of the Canalside Conservation Area's character or appearance and results in less than substantial harm, with a lack of demonstrable public benefits to outweigh this harm.

The development does not comply with the NPPF (2024), the National Design Guide (2021) Policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy DAA of the Ealing Local Plan (Reg 19) (2024) and the Generic Management Plan for Conservation Areas (2023).

| The exitsing building, by reason of its proximity to a Site of Importance for Nature Conservation (SINC), fails to minimise the overall spatial impact of the SINC and mitigate it by improving the quality or management of the rest of the site.
The development does not comply with Policy G7 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development, because of a combination of its proximity to the railway, height and visibility, and design, provides opportunity for trespass onto the railway, resulting in potential impacts to public safety, with insufficient measures to deter and design out criminal activity.
The development does not comply with Policy D11 of the London Plan (2021).
| The application for retrospective planning permission inaccurately demonstrates the existing situation on the site with the buildings proximity to the Grand Union Canal inaccurately represented.
As such, the proposal does not comply with Paragraph 140 of the NPPF (2024).
description: Retention of a single storey building serving the existing storage, distribution, processing and recycling facility. (Retrospective Planning Application)
